3	Edited by gotoAndLego, 03 April 2010 - 02:57 PM.

3	Dang!

3	So much negativity on a such spectacular set!

3	This baby provides an amazing backdrop to any Lego inspired Star Wars diorama.

3	And lets face it Lego tends to be a rectangular brick and somehow we now have a sphere!!!

3	Guys... its a UCS.

3	It accurately depicts the on screen icon and put plain and simple is a wonderful sculptural piece of work in its own right.

3	I agree with KimT in that the removal of the laser and Super Star Destroyer gives it more authenticity but to call it a gray golf ball or ignore its inherent accuracy is simply to miss the point.

3	It proved to be the best build to share with someone, be it family or friend due, to its repeated sections and impressive finish.

3	Its a clever build and to criticize it for lack of playability or (I suspect for many) its absence of minifigs is just absurd and possibly why Lego has not released a proper UCS in nearly two years.

3	I reckon many out there would love a UCS Tyderium, Imperial Walker or Slave 1 with a spectacular piece count be it minifig scale or just darn impressive in its own right.

3	Sadly for those who love these sculptural masterpieces we're stuck with simple toys with 'play features' and cute minifigs.

3	Clever in their own right but lacking the clout and purity of the old UCS line.

3	Let's hope some diversity of product is just around the corner else 10179 was the last of the truly brave financial gambles of the Star Wars line....

2	I decided to re-read this review because I just got this set today.

2	I dont really have a concern over the design or repeating build process because owning this set was never an option for me as I collect UCS sets...

2	But I am surprised to see an almost total lack of positive posts.

2	I really hope that I enjoy this build.

2	Hi, you may find this thread interesting, I really enjoyed Bricklinking it

1	I bricklinked it too back in the day.

1	It was an interesting build - just thought building the "unfinished" hemisphere was kind of tedious.

3	I've just ordered the bits for this from bricklink (I'm awaiting the final order now) so I'm interested in these comments.

3	I can see that, since I'll be building it with the kids, I'll have to plan in plenty of breaks and do lots of parallel building to keep us all from getting bored!

3	7656 General Greivous's Starfighter Release: 2007 Number of Pieces: 232 Minifigs: 1 Brickset Welcome!

3	This is my first review, so contstructive critisism is very much appreciated!

3	On to the review: First, we start out with the box: The box art is the same as always since 2006. nothing special.

3	Then we start the build.

3	The build is fairly easy, and will take the seasoned builder about 15-20 min to complete.

3	Here is the finished model: and bird's eye view: As you can see, this ship is very sleek.

3	The fins or "wings" each have an outer slope and an inner one, with the guns in between.

3	There are also cones on the front of the fins, which give the ship an even more sleek look.

3	In the middle of the wings there is the main body, with a big slope and stripes decorating it.

3	This set has a very good playability factor, as I'm about to show you now.

3	The guns on the ship are pretty cool looking to begin with; a bley slope attaching a lightsaber hilt and a trans-neon green stud to the fin on each side.

3	But theres more than what meets the eye: Yes, the guns flip up!

3	...and they can flip all the way back to hide them, for whatever case they need hiding.

3	Lets have a look at the back, there is a tail fin used as landing gear and some lightspeed boosters: But wait...

3	The tail fin can flip up for flight thanks to a hinge attached to the back of the cockpit.

3	Heres another playability factor: The cockpit can slide open very smoothly and easily.

3	Heres how this is possible: A clever system under the hood allows the cockpit to open.

3	See those two bley pieces on the black ones?

3	Those bley ones attach to the tan plates under the hood, and the hood and windsheild attach to the black peices.

3	The black and bley pieces work together as a sliding system, so the cockpit opens.

3	Viola!

3	And then the cockpit snaps in place thanks to the red hook and clip.

3	Its a very accurate system, and works very well.

3	You'll want to open and close it over and over again!

3	Now, finnaly to the fig: The General himself.

3	A very impressive fig, with a new head and torso mold.

3	In this set, (which is one of only two with Greivous in it) he comes with 2 green and two blue lightsabers, all with bley hilts ( ).

3	I was hoping for chrome hilts, but its a minor fault.

3	Grievous also comes with a new mold pistol blaster (not pictured).

3	Heres the General in the cockpit (sadly a weak cockpit, no details): He just half lays down on a small slope.

3	In this set, he doesnt come with a cape beacuse with it on, the cockpit doesnt close.

3	Thats about it, heres the...

3	FINAL VERDICT: Build: 7/10 Fairly easy but fun.

3	A little bit weak.

3	Playability: 8/10 Many playability factors, but some are boring or pointless.

3	Swooshability: 8/10 very fun to fly around, sometimes pieces break off.

3	Minifigs: 10/10 one amazing fig with 4 lightsabers and a new blaster.

3	what more could you ask for?

3	Design: 9/10 very sleek, but hardly any real texture.

3	i like it, but others might want greebling.

3	Price: 10/10 Overall Score: 9/10 A very cool ship with a very cool minifig and accessories.

3	One of the best SW sets I have ever seen for its small price I highly recommend it to any kind of SW, LEGO, or SW LEGO fan.

3	Hope you enjoyed my review, please leave feedback!

3	Edited by JimButcher, 15 September 2008 - 03:01 AM.

1	Jameseh, on Jun 28 2008, 08:24 PM, said: Does the sliding cockpit come off easily?

1	My friends brothers breaks everytime you touch it, but he may have built it wrong.

1	It put me off the set.

1	im very sad to say that SOMETIMES it does.

1	but thats only if you hold it from the top and bottom with your fingers and thumb respectivly.

1	But if you hold it in your palm or from the sides, it wont break.

1	Emphasis on sometimes.

1	But dont try to mess around with it by removing its pieces or adding new one, or modding it in any way, because the sliding mechanism wont agree with the mods and break.

1	But this hardly takes away from anyone liking this set because, IMO, its perfect just how it is.

3	Hello all Eurobricks members, I will be doing the second wave of the 2008 Impulse set series, which had released recently.

3	I bought this set earlier ago, and will like to share this comprehensive review with everyone of you.

3	Name: Troll Warrior Theme: LEGO System / Castle Year: 2008 Pieces: 19 Minifigs: 1 An image of a 5618, Troll Warrior Let the march begin The mighty brave troll warrior, carrying a dangerous cart equipped with a "flick" fire missile.

3	Marching into the lands of the Crown Kingdom.

3	Crown Knights must be ready for this new troll addition.

3	From what I see, this set has a very minimum piece count since it's an impulse set.

3	There is no unique parts found in this set.

3	However, this set has a couple of useful accessories, such as 2 spears and 2 wooden wheels and a grey mouse running around.

3	This set is another alternative for Castle Army builders to buy multiple sets, to build a massive Troll armies.

3	In addition, the flick missile really works.

3	Use a little bit of force from your finger and flick it, the missile will fly.

3	Well, it certainly does not impress me at all with such playing feature.

3	Base of the cart Different angles There is one thing I dislike about this set.

3	The wooden wheels are too big, and it is the same as the ones in the Crossbow attack.

3	I prefer the smaller wheels that exist in old castle sets that produced smaller cart.

3	Since this cart size is similar to the old cart size.

3	The old wizard's cart is a very good example of the proposed wheel.

3	Bits and Pieces Close-up on the warrior and the mouse Summary review Playability: 5.5/10 (The playability feature is not fanastic.)

3	Design: 6.5/10 (Design is adequate.

3	If the wheels is much smaller and the flicking thing disappear, the score will be much higher) Price: 8/10 (An inexpensive set to get a troll warrior and a mouse.)

3	Overall: 6/10 (To conclude, this set is good only for army builders.

3	A new range of millitary vehicle to be added.

3	That's all) Hope everyone of you enjoyed reading this simple review of mine.

3	Comments and Critics are strongly welcomed.

3	Pictures can be found in My Brickshelf (When moderated) Edited by KimT, 10 August 2008 - 01:29 PM.

3	Shoc, on Jul 4 2008, 01:00 AM, said: Why is mouse friendlier than rat?

3	Well, mouse sounded more friendly, because it can associate with Tom and Jerry.

3	But, calling it a rat equal calling it a pest..

3	It's just a matter of putting it in different terms.

3	That's all.

3	Edit: Instead of posting another post to explain why I used mouse.

3	I will write it here.

3	Tom and Jerry is reflected as a cartoon.

3	Children associate Jerry as a mouse, since its supposed to be heart-warming and make us laugh.

3	In real life, there are many different pets we raised.

3	One of the possible pets we considered is a mouse.

3	Mouse are supposed to be shy and friendly creatures that live in harmony.

3	While rats lived in packs, hunt food in the dark and is widely regarded as a "pest".

3	In this review, I am trying to illustrate rat and associate it with mouse by presenting it in a much friendly approach.

3	There is no right or wrong answer.

3	It's just making use of different words to represent how I feel towards a particular thing.

3	Edited by WhiteFang, 04 July 2008 - 08:08 AM.

2	WhiteFang, on Jul 4 2008, 05:43 PM, said: Well, mouse sounded more friendly, because it can associate with Tom and Jerry.

2	But, calling it a rat equal calling it a pest..

2	It's just a matter of putting it in different terms.

2	That's all.

2	The thing I dont get is how Jerry is friendly

3	This is a nice way of building up orc armies, but I do wish it was designed like the Knight impulse set.

3	There you have a minifig, enough weapons and armor for two figs and a weapons rack made out of basic pieces.

3	Add a generic fig from your collection and you have two knights and the pieces from the rack can be easily used in MOCs.

3	The pieces that make up the siege weapon in the Orc impulse are not as easy to use in other creations.

3	I'd rather have seen a "Orcish" weapons rack (different from the Knights rack, but like it, using basic elements) with a second helmet, another weapon, the Orc armor and a shield to put on it.

3	Still, although not as good as the Knight impulse, it's a nice little set.

3	WhiteFang, on Jul 4 2008, 03:43 AM, said: Tom and Jerry is reflected as a cartoon.

3	Children associate Jerry as a mouse, since its supposed to be heart-warming and make us laugh.

3	In real life, there are many different pets we raised.

3	One of the possible pets we considered is a mouse.

3	Mouse are supposed to be shy and friendly creatures that live in harmony.

3	While rats lived in packs, hunt food in the dark and is widely regarded as a "pest".

3	Where I come from people keep both as pets.

3	However, if either are found in the house uninvited, they are considered pests.

3	And if you look at the Chinese zodiac, rats are very well thought of and are symbols of prosperity.

3	Hello all Eurobricks members, I will be doing a continuation of my Impulse set reviews.

3	I was pretty excited when I laid my hands on these new impulse sets yesterday.

3	Hope to give most of you a good insight for this set.

3	Name: Street Cleaner Theme: LEGO System / Town / City Year: 2008 Pieces: 22 Minifigs: 1 An image of a 5620, Street Cleaner Let the cleaning begin The Street Cleaner has a job to do.

3	It is to clean the rubbish on the streets, after a New Year Countdown.

3	It seemed the cleaning agency have a new equipment to use.

3	It's not as big as the previous street sweeper machine.

3	The cleaner will need to operate the equipment manually, by pushing it.

3	Look at the mess After sorting out Look at the pieces offered.

3	It's not a very complicated set, since it's an impulse set.

3	There are some pretty useful parts lying around such as the broom, spade.

3	However, I was quite surprised when I could not find the lid of the rubbish bin.

3	I can't used this rubbish bin to place it around my town, without a lid on top of it.

3	I believed it is not a norm, by not including the lid.

3	Look at that bin Well, that rubbish bin seem to be containing his equipment in it, instead of the rubbish.

3	The cleaner's face looks pretty sad.

3	I think he wants to have a change of job.

3	Front View I love that blue brush very much.

3	Quite fun to play with, especially pushing the rubbish aside.

3	That's why a spade is there to help him to dig out the litter and the broom to brush it away.

3	Ok, now I know why his face looks so sad!

3	Where is that Street Sweeper machine?

3	Summary review Playability: 6.5/10 (Not bad to play with) Design: 7.5/10 (The design is relatively interesting, with the use of the technic part, to be its foundation.)

3	Price: 8/10 (An inexpensive set to get another cleaner and some neat accessories.)

3	Overall: 7/10 (Not a bad set after all.

3	Pretty average, but still quite good to buy if your towns required more cleaners.)

3	Hope everyone of you enjoyed reading this simple review of mine.

3	Comments and Critics are strongly welcomed.

3	Pictures can be found in My Brickshelf(When moderated) Edited by WhiteFang, 04 July 2008 - 03:44 PM.

3	Hello all Eurobricks members, I will be doing a continuation of my Impulse set reviews.

3	This will be the third review at a go.

3	Hope everyone of you will find this review useful in a way.

3	Name: Coast Guard Kayak Theme: LEGO System / Town / City Year: 2008 Pieces: 21 Minifigs: 1 An image of a 5621, Coast Guard Kayak Roll Roll, Roll your boat It seemed the coast guard has a kayak of his own, roaming in the sea, making sure that swimmers will be safe in the beach.

3	Now, I am illustrating him as a life guard instead.

3	This set is simply wonderful.

3	Among the 4 new impulse sets, Coast Guard Kayak is the best looking set in my opnion.

3	The kayak design is very simple but looks realistic .

3	Furthermore, if you don't need it to be a coast guard kind of stuff.

3	Use it as a leisure water spot instead down in the marina.

3	I will think any LEGO citizen will love to have some water spot in their busy life.

3	So come down here and wind down with this new sport.

3	Bits and Pieces Kayak and the bouy The bouy is very useful to position it at the coast of your water to highlight the boundaries in the sea, and warning incoming ships or vessels.

3	Oh, I did not make it tilted purposely.

3	There is a white round base which allow it to tilt on both ends.

3	Useful parts These parts are useful to add on in your city.

3	Somehow, when I see that red cone, I can use it as a police stop, to inspect vehicles on the road or form a barricade with it.

3	The bouy base shape is unique too.

3	I like it very much.

3	It is great to attached it by the side of the boat as a life bouy.

3	The coast guard's life vest and helmet are very useful for water activites.

3	The life vest was produced in past sets, and now it re-surfaced again.

3	I am glad these vests made their way back.

3	A look of him, without the life vest Summary review Playability: 7.5/10 (Fun to play with, especially the bouy when you see it moving up and down.)

3	Design: 8.5/10 (Design is simple but straight to the point, especially the kayak design.)

3	Price: 8/10 (An inexpensive set to get more coast guards and more kayaks.)

3	Overall: 8.5/10 (A very good set to have in your LEGO town.

3	The kayak is simply so lovely to me.)

3	Hope everyone of you enjoyed reading this simple review of mine.

3	Comments and Critics are strongly welcomed.

3	Pictures can be found in My Brickshelf (When moderated)

3	Hello all Eurobricks members, This will be my last impulse set review for the second wave.

3	Hope everyone of you will find my reviews useful and helpful in your purchase.

3	Name: Crystal Hawk Theme: LEGO System / Mars Mission Year: 2008 Pieces: 26 Minifigs: 1 An image of a 5619, Crystal Hawk Alpha 3 in Sector 5, reporting to base Alpha 3, Crystal Hawk, reporting for duty, Sir!

3	May I present Mars Mission, latest scout craft, code named "Crystal Hawk".

3	This spacecraft looks very sleek and cool with its usual white and orange color combination.

3	I am not a fan of Mars Mission, but these white mini-figs simply attracted me for it.

3	In fact, I only owned its impulse sets, and none of its main sets.

3	Nevertheless, this set has the "swoosh" factor.

3	I was swooshing around in my home last night.

3	Well, I am not swooshing it like KimT though.

3	Am I seeing double?

3	Haha, the answer is "No".

3	It has double sided face.

3	I combined the pictures, to illustrate the two facial expressions.

3	Bits and Pieces Different angles Love the way how the wings bend upwards and downwards.

3	The only thing I find it a little bit wierd for spacecraft.

3	Normally, I thought joystick is the typical navigation controls for a spacecraft instead of a steering wheel?

3	I am not complaining about a steering wheel in a spacecraft.

3	To me, it's quite an uncommon sight.

3	Anyway, the white steering wheel is an useful part for making vehicles MOCs.

3	Summary review Playability: 8/10 (Fun to play with when you bend the wings up and down.)

3	Design: 8.5/10 (Design is simple, but creates a sleek and cool look.)

3	Price: 8/10 (An inexpensive set to get more scout craft and mars mission mini-figs) Overall: 8.5/10 (A very good set to have for any Mars Mission fans, and for collectors like me whom can't afford all Mars Mission sets, this set is a very great alternative.)

3	Hope everyone of you enjoyed reading this simple review of mine.

3	Comments and Critics are strongly welcomed.

3	Pictures can be found in My Brickshelf (When moderated)

3	One of the better impulse sets IMO.

2	Edited by Shoc, 20 July 2008 - 07:45 PM.

2	7663 Sith Infiltrator Year: 2007 Number of Pieces: 310 Number of Minifigs: 1 Price: 29.99 USD Brickset Hello everyone, and welcome to my second review on Eurobricks, the Sith Infiltrator!

2	Lets start with a pic of the box, shall we?

2	As you can see, its a Limited Edition set, meaning the fig and set could be worth a lot in the future.

2	This set takes about 20 minuets for the seasoned builder.

2	An overview of the Infiltrator (also know as the Scimitar): As seen in the picture, this ship is very sleek, with very few studs on top (SNOT= Studs Not On Top).

2	Basically, Its the cockpit with two wings (with two "fins" on each wing), attached to the hull.

2	Heres a side view of the Scimitar: Very cool- looking!

2	It lands on two "feet" in the front while the cockpit rests on the ground.

2	Rear view: The back.

2	The outer cockpit is beautiful, a printed piece on the back (no dreaded sticker sheet!

2	(DSS)) and a large printed disc on top: Heres a look at the middle: There is a flick-fire missile (trans-red cone attach to Technic pin) on the inner wing, a trans-red lightsaber blade in the back of the hull, and a trans-red lightsaber blade in between the fins on either side.

2	All of those lightsaber blades may come in handy... Hey, look: the fins open from the wings!

2	: The fins open due to double hinges on each fin.

2	Unfortunately, you have to hold the ship up in order for the bottom fins to open.

2	Now, lets have a look inside the cockpit: To open, you lift the back printed part, which is attached to the printed disc on top, which is attached to a hinge.

2	It opens pretty smoothly, but is somewhat loose, so sometimes it closes on its own.

2	Also, the disc isnt secured well enough to the door, and often breaks off, even with the smallest movement to it.

2	Inside, there is an elevated control panel and two sliding pieces near the floor.

2	This ship also comes with a small speeder bike: Its very cleverly built, and is a really neat addition.

2	See that clear disc on the bottom?

2	It fits perfectly into the sliding pieces in the cockpit: Hmm... whats this?

2	: A hidden compartment!

2	Now this was a very cool idea by TLG, a secret compartment found by taking off the top slope of the hull contains Darth Maul's weapons and tools which include: A (CHROME!)

2	lightsaber hilt, a pair of electrobinouculars, and three probe droids.

2	A closeup of a probe droid: Just a plain, black minifig head with a black lever on top.

2	Finally, the fig: Darth Maul in the flesh plastic.

2	A good fig altogether, with a black hood and lightsaber blades taken from the ship.

2	He did come with a crisp, new black cape (packaged in a small, white cardboard box), but I am currently using it for another fig.

2	Note that this is a limited edition fig, so stock up.

2	A comparison pic of the two Mauls: The 2007 version is on the left, and the 1999 version on the right.

2	Note a few key differences between the two: the new one has smaller red tattoos and a smoother torso.

2	Also, the new one has bigger eyes and a more cartoony look.

2	Maul on the speeder bike: Of course, he fits perfectly in the cockpit wile sitting on the bike, and he can reach the controls: Well, thats about it, here is the...

2	FINAL VERDICT: Build: 8/10, easy and fun, breaks every once in a while.

2	Playability: 7/10, this set has many features, but is very fragile between the cockpit and hull and between the two cockpit pieces.

2	Swooshability: 1/10, too fragile to fly around, plus the flick fire missiles fall out.

2	Minifigs: 9/10, a great fig with a chrome hilt and a double sided blade.

2	A little cartoony.

2	Design: 7/10, very clever techniques, very sleek, but very fragile.

2	Price: 8/10, fair enough, could be a few dollars cheaper.

2	Overall Score: 6.5/10, a very sleek ship with clever building and play techniques, but very, very fragile, and shouldnt be picked up off of the shelf too often.

2	And with that, my review is over, but all of yours are not: comments and thoughts very welcome!!

2	Edited by JimButcher, 15 September 2008 - 02:59 AM.

3	Hey all!

3	So I purchased the remaining three Agents sets I needed, and saw that there was no review up yet for this set!

3	Heres the first batch of parts, and the first instruction bits.

3	The mini figures.

3	The first small vehicles.

3	Heres a mistake that I found in the instruction booklet.

3	There is no difference between steps 2 and 3.

3	The team Inferno boat.

3	This is a nice chunky boat, that looks fairly heavy duty and evily.

3	Its nice to see the smooth disks on the bottom, that LEGO seemingly havnt done in recent boat/plane sets.

3	And the Agents Submarine!

3	This is a nice build aswell.

3	Nice and long, with a few hidden compartments.

3	One for missiles.

3	A place to put the treasure!

3	Some final shots of the completed set!

3	The spare bits!

3	Another special mention has to go out to Slime Face.

3	I think he is my favourite ever LEGO character.

3	The detail on his unique torso is brilliant!

3	His head is fantastic!

3	And his costume just looks great, with the black and green (Plus green is my favourite colour!)

3	Check out the back of his torso, with the slime pouring down!

3	Deep Sea Quest was £34.99 Price ; 9/10 - This is a pretty reasonable price for a fairly substantial set.

3	Parts ; 8/10 - A lot of nice bits, few nice boats bits, and a lot of smooth disk things.

3	Minifigures ; 10/10 As I said Slime Face is my favourite LEGO character, and the details brilliant!

3	Vehicles ; 8/10 Both very good, with some interesting features.

3	Build ; 8/10 A pretty fun build.

3	Overall ; 9/10 Its gotta be, if just for Slime Face alone, but this really is a great set!

2	Batbrick, on Jul 19 2008, 09:53 AM, said: Is it impossible or just very hard to mod?

2	Nothing is impossible to mod!

2	Probably the easiest part to change would be the front where the missiles are and the treasure chest slides out - you could make a sizeable compartment there.

2	However the middle section is so narrow and the end fins are just that - fins - that it might be harder to expand without changing the shape of the sub.

2	You'll find out soon when yours arrives!

2	Batbrick, on Jul 19 2008, 09:53 AM, said: The octopus sounds great, thanks for that, is he meant to be on any side?

2	I know he has slime marks on his head, are they very apparent?

2	It's not really clear but since all the other mutants are evil (or at least controlled by Dr Inferno), it's probably a safe bet the squid is too.

2	Slime Face's head is different to the Joker bombs - different eyes and teeth (although the smile is similar I guess) and the slime marks are much more apparent in the flesh (or ABS) although they don't photograph that way.

2	Great review I just thought I'd comment saying thanks because if I had'nt found this review I'd of never made an account on eurobricks!

3	6927 All Terrain Vehicle Year Released: 1981 Piece Count: 167 Minifigs: 2 List Price: $14.50 A very unique vehicle in the Classic Space collection was this "All-Terrain Vehicle" which I always considered more along the line of a Mobile Lab.

3	The set introduced/infused white and black bricks with classic blue space pieces.

3	The result was this great classic vehicle.

3	The set includes two figs (still red and white): Here's a view of the vehicle which is really two components, the vehicle itself and the lab section: I absolutely loved the the blue windshield slopes (2 included), and the unique upside-down large blue slope: In the back of the vehicle is the blue lab: The back section of the vehicle has hinges that allow the jets sections to open: The brick design fits perfectly into the lab, and when opened, the lab falls to the ground: NOTE: the little round trans.

3	red 1x1s allow the lab to slide up and forward when the jet sections are closed.

3	I tried taking off the red 1x1s and the lab does not lift as easily with them.

3	The design is very clever, esp.

3	for a classic set.

3	Here's a shot of the stand-alone lab: Unlike earlier Classic Space windows, this set has train window frames with yellow windows.

3	The top of the lab lifts up for playability: Inside the lab are several computers and a swivel chair: Back to the vehicle, here's a shot of the cockpit with white steering wheel: The left side has an upside-down wrench and black antenna: The right side, a walkie-talkie and another antenna.

3	The antennas can be used as breaks to keep the middle wheels from moving: Here's ashot of the under carriage: And a final shot of the complete set: For those of you following my Classic Space reviews, this is review number 9 of 10.

3	My final review of an-all time favorite will be coming soon.

3	Hope you enjoyed this review.

3	Comments are always welcome.

3	This is one of my favorite space sets of all time.

3	I even had 2 of them back in the days.

3	My only complain about this set was that I found that the wheels where too small , I had some trouble passing the rover over the little "craters-mountains" of the space plates

3	This is a great little set.

3	I like how it combines two very different color schemes for different parts of the model.

3	I have made some slight modifications to mine, adding a roof on the vehicle and a back wall on the outpost.

3	Also, those white 1x1 headlight plates at the front are thinner than the modern kind and seem to be quite weak.

3	I got this set off ebay a while ago and one of them was broken in shipping, even though the set was otherwise in display model condition, and the other one broke off while I was building the set.

3	I replaced them with the newer variety.

2	Great review!

2	All-Terrain Vehicle was one of my two favorite LEGO sets ever.

2	I have to include a shot of the back of the box, because I love the ideas LEGO provided for this set: hewman, on Jul 11 2008, 01:11 AM, said: Very nice Blacktron-themed 6927!

2	CP5670, on Jul 11 2008, 01:39 PM, said: I just modified mine to make everything fully enclosed: I love your modified 6927 with the enclosed front.

2	2 weeks ago I modified my All-Terrain Vehicle as well, in a similar way, but just *slightly* more modified from the original.

2	I call it: 6927-C 'All-Terrain Vehicle Improved Class' a few clues for anyone to easily build this themselves: Also, a much more extensive modification/MOC that I call 6927-W "All-Terrain Warrior" Quote 6927-W 'All-Terrain Warrior' I wanted to make a combat variant of 6927, so I used the 6927-C Improved Class as the starting point and went from there.

2	I added a completely new forward-cab, close to the ground, for a ground--observer to monitor the terrain.

2	I added even larger wheels, allowing this variant to truly be "all terrain", ...besides, what good is it having a combat vehicle if it gets stuck in the middle of a firefight?

2	The 6927-W has a five man crew: a driver, a gunner who also serves as overall-commander, a terrain observer in the very front.

2	In the lab are the weapons systems officer and computer/tech specialist.

2	The All-Terrain Warrior vehicle portion is armed with lasers and blaster cannons, with options for other weapons.

2	There are short-range nuclear rockets on the lab, guided by the rader control.

2	The lab now has blast-proof shutters on the windows protecting the crew from rocket blast.

2	Additional protection can be added to the lab, if-need-be, such as more extensive blast-shielding.

2	All-in-all, the All-Terrain Warrior is a beast of a machine.

2	Two 6927s can protect an entire convoy of standard 6927 or 6927-C.

2	These are my very first attempts at modification and doing a MOC of Classic Space LEGO!

1	I recently bought this set for my daughters birthday.

1	It's the first BELVILLE set that I've bought for her so it's a bit of an experiment.

1	The house is 5 rooms and it's made up of mostly large pieces.

1	There still is a decent amount of normal LEGO in it though.

1	The doorways in the house align when it is opened out.

1	Starting with the bathroom, included is a shower, toilet, sink with vanity and a baby potty.

1	The mirror sticker is one of the few that I put on.

1	The open plan lounge/kitchen/dining room is well appointed as well and it has a nice glass table and coffee machine.

1	The kitchen chairs are Fabuland parts... and don't work really well.

1	It seems they are having jellyfish for dinner!

1	The clock is the only printed part in the set.

1	Upstairs is a baby room and the master bedroom.

1	The radio and the TV (not shown) were stickers to my disappointment.

1	Up top is an extra room suitable for reading.

1	(Those antenna things were made from spare parts by my daughter.

1	I have no idea what they are supposed to be... ) There are some stickers that go on the back, but I didn't put them on.

1	As it is the set looks OK this way, but since it is a dolls house it doesn't really matter.

1	I do think though that the fireplace should have been given a back.

1	The BBQ is made from normal parts and is quite effective.

1	I think it uses the same light brick that's in the 4998 Stegosaurus set.

1	My kids were using it as a torch before my grumbling ruined their fun... Like all BELVILLE sets, the highlight is arguably the accessories.

1	I'll be borrowing a few of these from time to time...

1	Here is the controversial baby catapult.

1	As you can see, it works OK, but LEGO probably should have tried a bit harder.

1	We also bought for her 7583 Playful Puppy.

1	It also comes with some nice accessories, but not enough to justify buying unless you want the rest of the parts.

1	Poor puppy; where does he sleep?

1	Here is my daughter assembling it.

1	She made me make the house though as she wanted to play a game we bought her.

1	(Note the LEGO drink bottles! )

1	I didn't take any photos of the figures as they don't seem to be anything new, but I can if people want me to.

1	At the time I was in bit of a hurry as I took these before bed so I wouldn't be stressed if the kids broke it the next day.

1	Overall, these sets seem overpriced to me, and hard to justify unless you actually want a buildable doll's house.

1	(Which we did.)

1	It's still too early to tell if my daughter likes it or not... but at this stage it seems she lost interest in a few days.

1	She does tend to go back to toys though.

3	Patience .... Great review, by the way.

3	The Belville sets are indeed overpriced, but they're probably Lego's best attempt at wooing the girl audience (I still hate the fact that TLC thinks they need separate "boy" themes and "girl" themes, but whatever).

3	They're a very nice alternative to Barbie -- you get posable figures with realistic body proportions, plus some creativity and building aspects thrown in.

3	I bought this today, mainly because it was 25% off, but I'd been eyeing it for a long time.

3	The accessories truly are brilliant!

3	There's so much here to be pillaged for other uses, as people have said.

3	I picked up heaps of new parts I've never had, or rare ones in even rarer colours.

3	To be honest, I was surprised and impressed by the range and versatility of the regular bricks as well.

3	When you look at the box art, what jumps out at you are the giant pink walls and curved pieces, but there's a nice amount of white arches and lime green bricks, not to mention all the windows and the trans blue 1x2x5 bricks.

3	7655: Clone Battle Pack Year: 2007 Number of pieces: 58 Number of minifigs: 4 Price: 9.99 USD Brickset Welcome to my third review on Eurobricks, I hope you enjoy!

3	While at any store that sells LEGO (Target, Wal-Mart, TRU, etc.

3	), you will notice that the clone battle packs on the shelf are way fewer in number than the droids battle pack.

3	As you might guess, the clones are way more popular, and finding them gets harder and harder as the release date of this set goes farther into the past.

3	So stock up!

3	Alright, heres a pic of the box: A small box, as expected for inexpensive sets like these.

3	Note the "Build your army" button on the front: TLG obviously is encouraging customers to buy multiples, and with good reason, which will be explained later in this review.

3	Well, lets get straight to it: The contents of this set.

3	You will notice a speeder bike, a gun turret, and some clones.

3	Looking good so far!

3	Lets have a look at the turret: An excellent Star Wars element to have around, especially for MOCing.

3	It is very cleverly built, using a tire guard from CITY sets for the general shape of the turret mount.

3	All you have to do is attach the (new mold!

3	explained later) gun to the 2x1 plate with the center stud, and... Presto!

3	I wonder how the clones build these turrets to fast in the middle of battle... A rear view: With a clone mounted: My only gripe about the turret is that you have to take off the gun in order for every clone to have a gun.

3	Now, we move on to the vehicle of the set, the speeder bike: A rather sleek and good looking bike, with some useful pieces on it as well, such as the blue cones, the megaphones, and the engines.

3	Some say it looks bare without the figs mounted on it, but I think it looks just fine.

3	The commander drives while a trooper shoots on the back.

3	A side view: And a rear view: My only gripe is the same as the turret: you have to remove the back gun for all the clones to have weapons while on foot.

3	The back pistol attaches to a 2x2 round studded plate with a Technic hole in the middle.

3	Finnaly, here are the new guns: This set comes with 1 new blaster rifle and three new pistols.

3	It could have included one more rifle for the turret.

3	And of course, the figs: Includes: 1 yellow commander (lovely fig), 1 Shocktrooper (comes with a pair of elctrobinouculars), and two regular troopers (so clean and white).

3	The figs are excellent, all that any SW or LEGO fan should want.

3	It could have maybe included one more regular trooper, but that might be pushing it.

3	Thats all for now, folks, here is the...

3	FINAL VERDICT: Build: 8/10, extremely easy, should take the seasoned builder about 5 minutes to complete.

3	A fun build, though.

3	Playability: 5/10, I guess you can get this with the droid battle pack and make them battle, but this set has no real play features of its own.

3	But it is good for collecting troops and using them for MOCs.

3	Swooshability: 9/10, I guess you can zoom the speeder bike around... Minifigs: 10/10, four great figs that should be bought in multiples, a great army builder.

3	Design: 10/10, a clever turret, an awesome speeder, and four great clones.

3	What more do you need in a 10 dollar set?

3	Price: 8/10, not bad I suppose, but if you calculate a dime for each piece, this set should come out to 5-6 dollars.

3	But still, billions of these are being sold world-wide, and TLG is making a ton of money off of them.

3	Overall score: 9.5/10, a truly memorable set, one that will be a favorite for ages to come, and very popular.

3	A great army builder for a small price, plus vehicle and turret!

3	With only a few very minor flaws, this set is one of the best of Star Wars.

3	And this concludes my review, and as always, comments are most welcome.

3	I got like 5 of theses Hope we get the New clone battlepack, Do you ever think we will?

3	We will only get 5 Clones if you buy all the New Republic sets...

3	Nice review!

3	I got over the gun problem with the shockie since the rebel in the Y-Wing doesn't need one.

3	I wish I could have gotten more of these but I'll know for next time.

3	This guy is so late!"

3	but I read your review and this idea got out of my mind!

3	7654: Droids Battle Pack.

3	Year: 2007 Number of pieces: 102 Number of minifigs: 7 Price: 9.99 USD Brickset Hi everybody, and welcome to my fourth review on Eurobricks.

3	Today, I will review the Droid Bttle Pack set.

3	NOTE: This set originally came with four megaphone blasters for each battle droid, but I replaced them (along with the crooked arms) with the new blaster pistols and new twisted arms.

3	A picture of the box: As it is on the shelves of major-retail stores.

3	A small box, as expected for inexpensive sets like these.

3	Note the "Build your army" button on the front: TLG obviously is encouraging customers to buy multiples, and with good reason, which will be explained later in this review.

3	An overview of the set's content: You can see a droid carrying vehicle, a STAP, and some battle/ super battle droids.

3	A look at the carrier: A light tank.

3	Note the guns on the front: The guns and cockpit can turn a little bit left and right from the main body.

3	Also, the guns can move up and down, free from the cockpit: And check out the cockpit: Two 2x1 center studded plates side by side for the pilot to stand on.

3	Now, moving on to the STAP: A small, very useful vehicle in the SW universe.

3	These are seen frequently in both the movies and games (as well as other multimedia).

3	The design is very clever, using vertical building and a clear stand.

3	Rear view: The guns/ handlebars can go this far back: And finally, the figs: The figs are very good, but very common.

3	We havent seen SBDs in a while, and now instead of metallic blue, they are metallic dark grey.

3	The worst part of this set is that the battle droids have the old arms and guns, while the droids in the MTT and clone pack (both of the same year as this) have the new ones.

3	I wonder why TLG decided to do that... again, This set originally came with four megaphone blasters for each battle droid, but I replaced them (along with the crooked arms) with the new blaster pistols and new twisted arms.

3	So thats about it, heres the...

3	FINAL VERDICT: Build: 8/10, very easy, should take the seasoned builder about 5-10 minutes.

3	Playability: 6/10, has a few play feature, but nothing exciting.

3	Is good for MOCs and army building.

3	Swooshability: 8/10, I suppose you could fly around the STAP... Minifigs: 7/10, the battle droids are good, but very common, and the dont come with new arms or guns.

3	The SBDs are very nice, and in a new color.

3	All figs are great for army building.

3	Design: 8/10, the STAP was clever, but the carrier was a little bulky.

3	Price: 10/10, as fair as it gets.

3	Overall: 7.5/10, the figs are great to have and make MOCs and armies, and the vehicles are pretty cool (the carrier is a little lame).

3	The main problem with this set is that the BDs dont get the new guns or arms, so they dont fit in with all the new sets.

3	Also, droids arent as cool as clones.

3	But the price is very fair.

3	And now, my review has ended.

3	Unfortunately, I believe this will be my last review for a long time for two reasons: one, the remaining sets that arent done (according to KimT's index) I either don't have or are broken or have missing pieces.

3	and two, my budget is low right now, and I wont be able to get the Clone Wars sets right when they are released, so someone will probably beat me to reviewing them.

3	Too bad, because I would love to do an RGS review... well, as always, comments very welcome!
